newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EWS could buy British Rail stake in Ferry Boats.
newsitem.headline: EWS could buy British Rail stake in Ferry Boats.

text.p: American-owned English Welsh and Scottish Railways Holding Ltd (EWS) could buy out British Rail's remaining 3.9 percent stake in Belgian cross-channel freight operator Ferry-Boats NV, Ferry Boats chairman Etienne Schouppe said on Tuesday.
"I learned today that EWS could aquire British Rail's interest," Schouppe told Reuters in an interview after Ferry-Boats annual shareholders' meeting.
Schouppe is managing director of Belgian national railways company SNCB/NMBS, which owns 83 percent of Ferry-Boats.
Belgian shipping company CMB owns 9.6 percent of Ferry Boats. Private and other small shareholders hold the balance.
Ferry Boats had a net profit, including losses carried over from 1995, of 170 million Belgian francs in 1996.

EWS is owned by a consortium of U.S. investors, led by Wisconsin Central Transportation Corp. Last year it acquired most of British Rail's freight businesses as part of the privatisation of the U.K. railway company's activities.
